The things is, the image is of German soccer player Lukas Podolski.  Podolski played as a striker for Arsenal and recently retired from international football. Breitbart 'confuses' German soccer player for gangster on jet-skis

Share
Tweet
What's This?
By Gianluca Mezzofiore2017-08-21 13:15:52 UTC

Steve Bannon is back to Breitbart News but that didn't prevent the far-right website from making a spectacular blunder. 

SEE ALSO: Here's what Breitbart's fashion section will look like

On Sunday, Breitbart published an article with the headline "Spanish Police Crack Gang Moving Migrants on Jet-Skis" featuring two men on a jet ski. The things is, the image is of German soccer player Lukas Podolski. 

Podolski played as a striker for Arsenal and recently retired from international football.

Will somebody tell Steve Bannon and the other geniuses at @BreitbartNews that the guy on the picture is German soccer star Lukas Podolski pic.twitter.com/zWqoQDBg3s

— Mathieu von Rohr (@mathieuvonrohr) August 20, 2017

Hey @BreitbartNews, that's actually Lukas Podolski, one of the finest footballers in the world https://t.co/DwHXE7BD1s pic.twitter.com/nR6aK3sTrI

— Anup Kaphle (@AnupKaphle) August 20, 2017

After a social media backlash, Breitbart changed the photo and published an editor's note. 

"This image appeared as an illustration of a person on a jet ski. Breitbart London wishes to apologise to Mr. Podolski," the statement read. 

"There is no evidence Mr. Podolski is either a migrant gang member, nor being human trafficked. We wish Mr. Podolski well in his recently announced international retirement."

WATCH: Three construction innovations that will change the way we build

"There is no evidence Mr. Podolski is either a migrant gang member, nor being human trafficked."
Correction is best bit of Breitbart story

— Gabriele Marcotti (@Marcotti) August 20, 2017

Topics: Activism, alt right, breitbart, Culture, far-right, football, soccer, steve bannon
